  • Obstetrics
  • Anaesthesiology

The study area of obstetrics is focused on pregnancies, births, and the postpartum period. This includes offering family planning and preventive health counseling services, as well as managing high-risk pregnancies and providing maternity care to women before, during, and after giving delivery (antenatal care). Due to the competence of our multidisciplinary specialists in managing issues that can arise during high-risk pregnancies, you and your unborn child will receive the best treatment possible.

The facilities at Hope Hospitals are excellent, and cutting-edge medical equipment is employed to treat patients. The more experienced doctors instruct and advise the workers and technicians. The patient’s medical condition is promptly tracked, and the proper care is given as needed.

Why choose Hope Hospitals for Obstetrics?

We appreciate these moments in a mother’s life and have a team available 24 hours a day, seven days a week to provide the necessary care and assistance.If there are sufficient postnatal treatment programmes, our paediatricians are readily available around-the-clock. Our Hope Hospital also offers access to a dietician, physiotherapist, and lactation specialist.

Our Hope Hospitals provide streamlined procedures, cutting-edge technology, specialized, interdisciplinary care, and an unmatched simplicity in addressing each patient’s medical requirements.

Services we provide

  • Infertility treatment
  • Pregnancy and childbirth
  • Family planning
  • Maternal fetal medicine and high pregnancy care
  • Pain management and labor epidurals are available 24/7
  • Postpartum care

Diseases during Pregnancy

  • Fetal Alcohol syndrome

Alcohol intake during pregnancy is risky since it can harm the unborn child. Alcohol consumption during pregnancy is never safe. Abstain. Alcohol can harm the unborn child even before you are aware that you are pregnant. Even if you do not intend to become pregnant, stop drinking. It’s best to cease as soon as possible.

Alcohol in any quantity or sort is not safe. Even beer and wine can be dangerous. Alcohol is metabolized differently by various females. Therefore, from one woman to the next, the consequences on the mother and infant may differ. Even a little bit of alcohol is bad for the unborn child. The best defense is to decide to stop drinking alcohol.

  • Fetal macrosomia

A neonate with an excessive birth weight is referred to as fetal macrosomia. The diagnosis of macrosomia during pregnancy is challenging and unreliable. Those newborns who weigh more than 4,000 g are categorized as macrosomic.

Overfeeding causes macrosomia. Overfeeding accelerates growth and weight gain. Ultrasound can estimate baby size, however it may be inaccurate. Macrosomic babies will be routinely examined for birth complications. Delivery may require a c-section or inducement.

  • Ectopic pregnancy

Ectopic pregnancy differs from normal pregnancy in that the fertilized egg does not attach to the uterine lining and the fetus does not develop in the woman’s uterus. Ectopic refers to an outside attachment, where the fertilized egg forms an attachment outside of the uterus.

Procedures we perform

  • Ventouse delivery

Ventouse delivery is vacuum-assisted surgical vaginal delivery. Regional anesthetic is usually used, however it can be done without. Inserting the soft cup into the vagina, the vacuum cup covers the baby’s head. Each tug induces negative pressure, lowering the baby.

  • Cesarean delivery

C-sections deliver babies through abdominal and uterine incisions. Sometimes elective, sometimes emergency. Regional anesthesia is used (either spinal or epidural block).

Surgery involves a lower abdominal incision (vertically or horizontally). After that, a uterine incision ruptures the amniotic sac. After the amniotic sac bursts, the baby is removed and the umbilical cord severed. Remove the placenta. Finally, sutures or staples close the incisions and sterile dressing is applied.

Precautions for a healthy pregnancy

Avoid Caffeine: Caffeine hinders the body’s ability to absorb iron, which is essential during pregnancy. It is a stimulant, thus it could give you a headache and keep you up at night.

Take prenatal care early: A healthy prenatal care is crucial for the developing fetus. A pregnant lady is examined for specific diseases that could cause difficulties during prenatal care.

Eat Healthy: A pregnant lady might need an extra 300 calories per day. Therefore, increased protein consumption encourages the fetus’s healthy growth.

Exercise regularly: The best approach to relieve stress during pregnancy is through exercise. It lessens aches and pains and stimulates the legs’ slow blood circulation.

Ensure the health of your emotions: Stress during pregnancy may result in difficulties for the fetus. As a result, choosing counseling or seeking the advice of an expert may be helpful.

Use prenatal vitamins: The main ingredients in prenatal vitamins are iron and folic acid. The likelihood of neural tube abnormalities in the fetus is decreased by folic acid.

 

Are repeated MRIs or ultrasounds during pregnancy harmful to the fetus?

Pregnancy-safe abdominal or transvaginal ultrasound procedures are used for prenatal diagnosis and imaging. Additionally, it is thought that MRI during pregnancy is safe and poses no danger to the unborn child.

 

What is gestational age?

A fetus’s gestational age. Your last menstrual period determines the weeks and days. Your doctor will discuss your pregnancy in weeks, not months. Pregnancy has three trimesters. The first trimester lasts 13 weeks. The second trimester runs from 14 to 27 weeks, and the third from 28 to delivery.

 

For the past six months, my husband and I have been trying to conceive without success. When should we consult a doctor about infertility?

After a year without birth control, infertility is detected. After six months, you may need an infertility evaluation. After infertility tests, you can explore treatment options.

 

What is prenatal care?

When you are pregnant, you receive prenatal care. It involves your healthcare provider’s care, your family’s support, and an increased emphasis on providing yourself with the care you require during this unique time. The best chance for a healthy pregnancy and healthy baby is with good prenatal care.

 

Is exercise permitted while pregnant?

Exercise is advised during pregnancy in addition to being acceptable. Pregnant women in good health should engage in 30 minutes of moderately strenuous activity most days of the week, according to the American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology.
